info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 21 at 2:48AM CDT until July 21 at 9:45AM CDT by NWS St Louis MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Illinois, including the following county, northern Fayette.
* WHEN...Until 945 AM CDT Monday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 248 AM CDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in northern Fayette County due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 7 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vandalia, St. Elmo, Ramsey, Brownstown, Wrights Corner, Avena, Shafter, Bingham, Bayle City and St. James. - This includes the following State Parks... Ramsey Lake State Park.
This includes Interstate 70 in Illinois between exits 61 and 76.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
